column1: #Text=Landscape painting with acrylic paint is easy .
#Text=There are 4 basic steps to any landscape Painting : Set up , Background , Detailing and Finish .
#Text=This guide is meant for beginner painters and provides only the fundamental steps in Acrylic Landscape paintings .
#Text=To help understand the steps and to have an example to follow , this guide will present and walkthrough an example landscape painting .
#Text=Before painting it is necessary to gather materials and prepare them before painting .
#Text=Here are the materials used in the example painting and suggested for any landscape painting .
#Text=Paint brushes ( 4in Square Painters brush , thin detailing brush , small fan brush , Medium Flat )
#Text=Acrylic Paint ( White , Black , Red , Blue , Yellow )
#Text=First find a quiet private space with minimal distractions so it is easier to paint , make sure the space has access to clean water and sufficient air flow .
#Text=Lay down newspaper over the workspace to prevent unwanted paint stains .
#Text=Fill a medium cup with warm soapy water for cleaning paint brushes .
#Text=Put the paints on the paper plate to mix and use .
#Text=Organize all the materials close for easy access while painting .
#Text=Either find an image on the internet or in a book or have a landscape already drawn .
#Text=Pick a simple landscape with more background than detail so it is easier to paint .
#Text=First “ activate ” the canvas by brushing a small amount of regular water throughout the whole canvas preferably using the 4in painter ’s brush , this allows the paint to blend better .
#Text=Identify the main background colors of each section , for example , on the example painting :
#Text=Mix and experiment with paint on the paper plate to create the desired color for a section of the background , use the flat medium brush to stir .
#Text=It is better to have more than enough of a created color rather than have to attempt to recreate the color afterwards .
#Text=Do each color one at a time for simplicity .
#Text=Using the medium flat brush take a “ brush full ” of the desired color and paint it onto the canvas with easy back and forth strokes .
#Text=Do not paint the details or the foreground until after all the background is completed .
#Text=After completing a color section , wash your brush and move onto the next section , if the next section is adjacent to another section , and you do not wish to blend the colors
#Text=let the previous section dry before painting the adjacent section .
#Text=On the example painting , the top and middle sections are blended together to create a sunset but the bottom and middle section are not blended to create a horizon .

#Text=After painting two colors on the canvas next to each other , mix a color a shade in between the two colors on a paper plate and paint it in the area between the two colors and take the two wet color on the canvas slightly blend them together on the canvas .
#Text=Once the background is completely painted and there are no more “ white spaces ” on the canvas , let the canvas dry before continuing onto the detailing and foreground .
#Text=Identify the depth of the painting and what aspects need to be painted first , for example in the example painting the sun must be done before the blades of grass and the horizon .

#Text=Using the small detailing brush , paint the smaller and more precise details of the foreground , Such as the rocks on the ground and the tree silhouettes and using the fan brush with a light amount of paint horizontally , softly dabbing the canvas to create leaves
#Text=Paint slowly and carefully with the thin detailing brush to create smooth lines and borders
#Text=After all the detailing has dried , look over the painting and observe areas where the paint may need another coat because it is streaky or thin .
#Text=It may be necessary to go over small details again to fix mistakes or make the detailing cleaner .
#Text=After all the paint has dried and the painting looks satisfactory , autograph the canvas in the bottom right corner , using a sharpie in the negative color of the paint in the area .
#Text=Put away the materials and clean the workspace
#Text=Sell the superior painting at an auction for $ 1.37 million
#Text=The more paint , the less streaky the paint is on the canvas
#Text=wear painting appropriate clothing and use newspaper to cover the workspace
#Text=Do not leave Paint Brushes in water !
#Text=Make sure to put the cap on when done .
#Text=Wipe off any extra paint with a towel or tissue to avoid getting the cap stuck on the paint .
